He described the proposal as modest based on the unstable macro-economic environment, Naira devaluation and the high rate of inflation in the country. 
Speaking at the inaugural National Executive Council meeting of NLC, Ajaero said the congress would engage the administration on the issues of the economy, industry and job creation through campaigns and policy advocacy. 
"The present administration should adopt an approach of developing policies and programmes to revitalise local industries, promote value processes in agriculture as a way of addressing the high level of unemployment and poverty in the country," he concluded.
